"\"Endless Quest\" Basic Version":
"\"Endless Quest\" is a quest in which you clear randomly generated missions, aiming to get the highest score that you can within the time limit.

You can earn points in the following ways:
・By completing \"Mission Orders\"
・By defeating enemies

You can increase your time limit in the following ways:
・By completing \"Mission Orders\"
・By reaching the \"Interval Area\""

"Each mission has \"Mission Orders\", which you can complete to earn points and increase your time limit.

The more you increase your time limit, the further you can go and the more points you can earn.

You will also earn better rewards at the end of the mission, so try to complete as many Mission Orders as you can."

"The \"Interval Area\" is a break point during the quest. When a player reaches this area, time pauses, and your time limit increases by a certain amount.

In addition, your number of available Half Doll uses replenishes, and you can purchase items at the shop. Make sure to stock up on items for the next mission."

"This explains rewards and score.

All enemy drops are available to pick up at the end of the quest.

Your Rare Drop Rate rises as your score increases, so work together and aim for a high score.

Your Endless Quest high scores are saved separately, split up by quest, difficulty level and conditions, and can be checked from the Quest Counter."

"This explains \"Score Types\".

Endless Quest high scores can be confirmed from the Quest Counter.

Separate high scores are saved for each difficulty level and \"Condition\"."

"This explains the types of \"Mission Orders\".

●Plus type
Every time you complete one of these Mission Orders, you will earn additional time.
Example) Defeat enemies from the front!
●Minus type
Every time you fail your goal, you lose time.
Example) Do not get incapacitated!
●Success type
A high-risk, high-reward order which awards additional time if you reach the goal, but none if you fail.
Example) Defeat 99 enemies in 60 seconds!"

"This explains \"Success Buffs\".

When you achieve Mission Orders, you may earn a strengthening buff for players in the next area.
This is called a \"Success Buff\".

Success Buffs apply only to that area.

The chance of Success Buffs occurring improves as you achieve more Mission Orders, so do your best to complete as many orders as you can."

"\"Mission Accident\"
This will explain \"Round Accidents\".

When proceeding to the next mission, a \"Mission Accident\" may occur, causing various effects, including strengthening enemies. These effects will continue until the end of the mission.

In addition, after clearing all missions, you will move onto the second lap, and a \"Round Accident\" will occur. As with a Mission Accident, this brings various effects, but they continue until the end of the lap."

"In Endless Quests, you have a separate high score for each possible way you can play.

Solo:
This is your score when playing the quest alone.

Duo:
This is your score when playing with one other person.

Trio:
This is your score when playing in a group of 3 people.

4 Classes:
This is your score when playing in a group of 4 people, all of different classes.

Free
This is your highest score regardless of conditions."
